intro: Dischistocalyx buchholzii, commonly known as the African yellowwood, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and opposite, simple leaves. It is valued for its hard, durable wood and is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
